question.title: Unable to decrease wait time between messages in Azure service bus SDK using java
question.body:
I am migrating to the newer SDK for azure service bus. When the 1st message is read , it simply waits for a fixed 1 minute to pick up the next message. I am unable to change this behaviour either by setting maxTimeOut in ServiceBusReceiverClient.java or by setting AmqpRetryOptions.

Any pointers to solve this would be really appreciated. i dont want to wait for 1 minute because we need to process millions of messages everyday. My processing is over in a few milliseconds.

I just need to read 100 or more messages and write them to kafka topic, then flush kafka..

<dependency>
        <groupId>com.azure</groupId>
        <artifactId>azure-messaging-servicebus</artifactId>
        <version>7.15.1</version>
    </dependency>

Here is my code.

AmqpRetryOptions retryOptions = new AmqpRetryOptions();
retryOptions.setTryTimeout(Duration.ofSeconds(10));
retryOptions.setDelay(Duration.ofSeconds(10));


ServiceBusReceiverClient receiver = new ServiceBusClientBuilder()
    .retryOptions(retryOptions)
    .connectionString(connectionStr)
    .receiver().maxAutoLockRenewDuration(Duration.ofMinutes(lockDuration))
    .prefetchCount(properties.getNumMsgs())
    .topicName(azure.getServicebusTopicName())
    .subscriptionName(azure.getSubscriptionName())
    .buildClient();

receiver.close();
kafkaProd.flushKafka();
